summary: Heavy and Light are too similar in vanilla. Much stronger difference between light & heavy playing styles. Heavy armor can reflect and absorb damage and avoid crits. Light armor can dodge attacks. Armor limits casting ability and stamina regen. Spell Failure introduced. Many more changes
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=f08020][size=3][b]This mod will continue in [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10037]ACE - Comprehensive Enhancements[/url]
I won\'t update this page anymore, but I\'ll leave it for people who like it in it\'s current state.
The master mod linked above will off modular file support, 
so you can still find updates to this mod there.[/b][/size][/color][/center]
[center]

[color=008080][size=3][b]Athyra\'s Comprehensive Enhancements - ACE - Armor[/b][/size][/color]

[img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-3-1333047161.jpg[/img]

[color=008000][size=4][b]What this Mod does[/b][/size][/color]

[color=008080][size=3][b] Light armor:[/b][/size][/color] ([url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-4-1333474761.jpg]click to see perk map[/url])
 * Perks still work without the helmet. (for compatibility with most armor-set mods)
 * Most perks work with light armor or unarmored
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-5-1333046906.jpg]Gambit Feint[/url] ~ 20% chance to dodge any attack but 5% chance to take +50% dmg, 3lvls, and +50% armor on 1st lvl
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-2-1333047040.jpg]Custom Fit & Matching Set[/url] combined ~ +10% armor if all light and +5% if set
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-1-1333046902.jpg]Unhindered & Windwalker[/url] combined ~ same effects
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-4-1333046906.jpg]Know Your Enemy[/url] ~ 2lvls, do more damage and criticals to enemies wearing light armor
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-5-1333474693.jpg]Spell Thief[/url] ~ reduce casting penalties.
 * Magicka Regen, Spell Failure, and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14495-2-1333823723.jpg]Sneak Ability[/url] change according to skill level or perks:

[b]If Light Armor skill lvl is under 30[/b]
-20% Sneaking Ability
[b]If Light Armor skill level between 30 and 70[/b]
-10% Sneaking Ability
[b]If Light Armor skill level 70 or more[/b]
No penalty for Sneak Ability

[b]Without the Spell Thief perks[/b]
-25% Magicka regen & 10% Spell Failure 
[b]After the Spell Thief 1 perk[/b]
-20% Magicka regen & 5% Spell Failure 
[b]After the Spell Thief 2 perk[/b]
-15% Magicka regen & No Spell Failure 


[color=008080][size=3][b] Heavy armor:[/b][/size][/color] ([url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-3-1333474760.jpg]click to see perk map[/url])
 * Perks still work without the helmet. (for compatibility with most armor-set mods)
 * Heavy Armor is [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14495-1-1333823722.jpg]5% more resistant to damage from Arrows, Daggers, Swords, and 1-handed Axes but is 5% more vulnerable to spell damage[/url].
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-1-1333047402.jpg]Tough As Nails[/url] ~ 40% chance to take half damage from any attack, 3lvls, and +60% armor on 1st lvl
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-2-1333047403.jpg]Well Fitted & Matching set[/url] combined ~ +15% armor if all heavy and +10% armor if set
 * Added Ebony armor to the matching set list. (fixed from vanilla)
 * \"Conditioning\" and \"Cushioned\" removed from perk tree
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-1-1333047287.jpg]Deflect Criticals[/url] ~ 2lvls, chance to receive a critical is -50% / -75% (ie. enemy crit chance 10% becomes 5% or 2.5%)
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-5-1333047289.jpg]Strong Back[/url] ~ adds 100 carry weight
 * Fists of Steel ~ now also doubles bashing damage
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-3-1333047288.jpg]Arms of Steel[/url] ~ 1h do +25% stagger, 2h +50% stagger (In parallel with Fists of Steel)
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-4-1333047289.jpg]Joint Splitter[/url] ~ 2lvls, do more damage and criticals to enemies wearing heavy armor
 * [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-3-1333474692.jpg]Armored Mage[/url] ~ reduce casting penalties.
 * Magicka & [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14495-3-1333823723.jpg]Stamina[/url] Regen, Spell Failure, [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14495-2-1333823723.jpg]Sneak Ability, and Movement Speed[/url] change according to skill level or perks.


[b]If Heavy Armor skill lvl is under 30[/b]
-30% Stamina regen & -80% Sneaking Ability & -20% Movement Speed
[b]If Heavy Armor skill level between 30 and 70[/b]
-25% Stamina regen & -60% Sneaking Ability & -15% Movement Speed
[b]If Heavy Armor skill level 70 or more[/b]
-20% Stamina regen & -40% Sneaking Ability & -10% Movement Speed

[b]Without the Armored Mage perks[/b]
-40% Magicka regen & 20% Spell Failure 
[b]After the Armored Mage 1 perk[/b]
-35% Magicka regen & 10% Spell Failure 
[b]After the Armored Mage 2 perk[/b]
-30% Magicka regen &  5% Spell Failure


[b]Notes
[color=00809e] * Click here for [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=14495]a version with no tree modifications[/url], it includes only armor penalties and rating reduction. *[/color]
 * Spell Failure means complete mana drain. Be careful! *
 * Spell Failure is simulated by temporarily increasing the cost of a spell by 10000, which you can sometimes see in the menu *
 * The skill level based changes happen automatically when reaching the right skill level. 
 * All armor effects are [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-1-1333474689.jpg]displayed in \"Active Effects\" if you want to check.[/url] * [/b]


[color=008080][size=3][b] Total armor bonus[/b][/size][/color]
 - Light = 73% ( 1.5 * 1.1 * 1.05 )
 - Heavy = 102% ( 1.6 * 1.15 * 1.1 )
 - Vanilla = 212% ( 2 * 1.25 * 1.25 ) - vanilla heavy and light have the same values, identical

[color=008000][size=4][b]The Goal of this Mod[/b][/size][/color]
- balance and diversify the use of armor giving them stronger more distinct roles
- widen the gap of similarity between the armor-types
- prevent mages from using heavy armor
- make light armored mages possible but more strategy is needed
- make heavy armor characters not be able to run as far or as long as in light armor
- make mage robes the best possible clothes for mages
- make heavy armor significantly more defensive than light armor

[img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10634-3-1333047040.jpg[/img]
[/center]

files.changelogHtml:
Introduced Sneaking and Movement Speed changes for armors.
Stamina Regen, Sneaking, and Movement Speed now scale to relative skill level, at lvls 30 and 70.
Heavy armor no longer gets +5% defense vs battle axes, but still gets it against war axes.
Added more information to the Active Effects menu.
